'Hyperprolinemia', also referred to as 'prolinemia' or 'prolinuria', is a
condition which occurs when the amino acid proline is not broken down properly
by the enzymes proline oxidase or pyrroline-5-carboxylate dehydrogense, causing
a build up of proline in the body.
